Name: A-Bomb
Summary: When a sidekick gains vast superhuman abilities, it could go one of two ways. Fortunately Rick Jones embraced his power and heroism as A-Bomb.

Name: Abin Sur
Summary: A powerful and righteous member of the Green Lantern Corps, unfortunately Abin Sur is mostly known for dying and giving his power ring to Hal Jordan.

Name: Abomination
Summary: Imagine if the Hulk was a Communist spy. Oh, and also an evil lizard. That's the Abomination.

Name: Abraxas
Summary: The Dimensional Destroyer. Has no qualms about either destroying the multiverse or walking around wearing a toga, and not sure which is worse.

Name: Absorbing Man
Summary: A violent criminal with the ability to mimic any substance he comes into contact with, Crusher Creel could be a formidable opponent if he wasn't so dumb...

Name: Adam Strange
Summary: A dashing space explorer who occasionally gets randomly teleported to an alien world. Also has a cool ray gun.

Name: Agent 13
Summary: Legendary SHIELD agent and seemingly the only person in the Marvel Universe who ages at a normal rate.

Name: Agent Bob
Summary: Sometimes a regular guy gets caught up with the wrong people. Bob doesn't really believe in Hydra and their message, but a guy's gotta work!

Name: Agent Zero
Summary: A government-sponsored super-agent with acidic fingertips. Is constantly breaking his phone.

Name: Air-Walker
Summary: Herald of Galactus, responsible for preparing worlds for his master to devour. Favours parmesan as a seasoning.

Name: Ajax
Summary: Robotic enemy of Deadpool. Susceptible to water. Hates log flumes.

Name: Alan Scott
Summary: The original Green Lantern, Alan Scott is man powered by a magic lamp. Unfortunately he is unable to grant wishes.

Name: Alfred Pennyworth
Summary: Little known fact: Batman is powered by tea and cucumber sandwiches. That's why his loyal butler Alfred Pennyworth is so important.

Name: Amazo
Summary: A hyper-adaptive robot who will copy your powers and your hairstyle.

Name: Ammo
Summary: Angry shooty man.

Name: Angel
Summary: A rich mutant with beautiful feathered wings, who sensibly chose 'Angel' over 'Bird' as a codename. Occasionally eats bird-feed.

Name: Angel Dust
Summary: A superhumanly strong woman who lives in the sewers. Big investor in air freshener.

Name: Angel Salvadore
Summary: A young woman with all the gross parts of insect biology. Sometimes hangs out in a cocoon like it's normal.

Name: Animal Man
Summary: A man who never grew out of the childhood trait of pretending to be an animal, although he's far more likely to maul you than a child would be.

Name: Annihilus
Summary: A creepy insect guy who rules over the Negative Zone and has an army of similarly creepy insect guys. Not so fun at parties.

Name: Ant-Man
Summary: A scientific genius who decided to use his vast intellect to give himself the ability to shrink and control ants. Go Ant-Man!

Name: Ant-Man II
Summary: Scott Lang, a petty thief who stole some stuff that makes him tiny and gives him control over ants. Gets arrested often.

Name: Anti-Monitor
Summary: Controller of the anti-matter universe, will probably contradict everything you say just for the sake of being petty.

Name: Anti-Venom
Summary: The polar opposite of the Venom symbiote, although weird people probably still want to have sex with it.

Name: Apocalypse
Summary: The first mutant. The beginning and the end. Racist against humans. Ill-defined powers. He. Is. Apocalypse.

Name: Aquababy
Summary: You know how babies are really good at swimming? Well, boring old regular babies ain't got nothing on Aquababy.

Name: Aqualad
Summary: Aqualads night out!

Name: Aquaman
Summary: How to describe Aquaman without saying he talks to fish...he converses with sealife? He commands crustaceans? Ok, he talks to fish.

Name: Arachne
Summary: A young woman with spider-powers and slightly more imagination when it comes to codenames than the many other Spider-Women out there.

Name: Archangel
Summary: The Horseman of Death. Doesn't actually ride a horse, but he's really good at the other thing.

Name: Arclight
Summary: Arclight! Use your shockwaves!

Name: Ardina
Summary: The Silver Surfer's literal trophy wife. Get it, because she looks like a trophy...?

Name: Ares
Summary: The God of War. Once got torn in half in a scene that would make George R R Martin feel queasy.

Name: Ariel
Summary: A young mutant with the ability to walk through walls. Had to learn how to respect people's privacy and boundaries real quick.

Name: Armor
Summary: Draws on her ancestry to generate a psionic exoskeleton. If I drew on my ancestry I'd probably just get alcoholism and diabetes.

Name: Arsenal
Summary: Really good with a bow and arrow, but really bad with saying no to drugs.

Name: Atlas
Summary: A Titan responsible for holding up the sky. Unfortunately has very ticklish armpits...

Name: Atlas
Summary: A mighty warrior who uses his fierce strength and noble bearing to occasionally try and beat up Superman.

Name: Atom
Summary: He's got a shrinking suit of armour. Fortunately he also shrinks along with the armour, otherwise things might get messy...

Name: Atom Girl
Summary: An alien who can shrink to sub-atomic sizes. Knows exactly what you've got under your couch and is mildly disgusted by it.

Name: Atom II
Summary: Enjoys spending time hanging out with microbes, swimming through his friends' bloodstreams, just being a cool guy.

Name: Aurora
Summary: A Canadian with super speed and light powers. Less polite than you might hope.

Name: Azazel
Summary: A literal demon who once became captain of a pirate ship which he used to raid Heaven.

Name: Azrael
Summary: A Knight of an ancient Holy Order who once became a really lurid 90s version of Batman. Got fired because he didn't mind killing.

Name: Aztar
Summary: The divine Spirit of Vengeance, occasionally hooks up with a Gotham City beat cop like a bad 70s TV show.

Name: Bane
Summary: The man who broke the bat. Possibly the most intimidating and grotesquely muscular man to ever wear a luchador mask.

Name: Banshee
Summary: An hilariously stereotypical Irishman who has the power to scream really loud. Sometimes he screams so loud he ends up flying.

Name: Bantam
Summary: Lackey of a temporal terrorist. You probably want to try again...

Name: Batgirl
Summary: A tech genius and probably deserving of a codename that makes her sound slightly less like a child.

Name: Batgirl II
Summary: AKA The Spoiler. Will definitely stay up until 2am to watch Game of Thrones just so she can tell you how it ends.

Name: Batman
Summary: If you've made it this far, understand the most important lesson of the Super Selector: Batman always wins.

Name: Batman II
Summary: Former Robin, occasional Batman stand-in. Not as grim and brooding as regular Batman, and sometimes his sidekick maims people.

Name: Batwoman
Summary: Like Batman, but a military-trained queer woman. So, you know, much cooler than Batman.

Name: Beak
Summary: Got the worst parts of being a bird-man out of being a mutant. No wings, just a wrinkly face and a pointy beak.

Name: Beast
Summary: Don't judge a book by its cover, otherwise Beast will throw that book at you while giving you a brief synopsis because he's definitely read the book.

Name: Beast Boy
Summary: Small, green, turns into animals. Animals which mostly turn out to be varying shades of green.

Name: Beetle
Summary: A petty criminal who should probably use his advanced cybernetic armour for something better than robbing banks.

Name: Beta Ray Bill
Summary: Make fun of his alien horse-face as much as you want, not everybody is worthy of a magic hammer bestowed by Odin.

Name: Beyonder
Summary: A cosmic being with vast power who likes making people fight for his amusement and occasionally needs to be taught how to use the toilet.

Name: Big Barda
Summary: She'll throw you through a wall!

Name: Binary
Summary: When Captain Marvel gets the power of an actual for-reals binary star, she feels like it's time for a rebrand.

Name: Bishop
Summary: He's from the future and yet really hates stuff that makes the future happen. Bishop, a walking contradiction.

Name: Bizarro
Summary: Oh cool, you got Superman...hang on, there's something not quite right here...

Name: Black Adam
Summary: An ancient Egyptian prince with the power of a thunderbolt and the attitude of an unrepentant A-hole.

Name: Black Bolt
Summary: Alien king who can scream so loud it'll level a city. Wouldn't say boo to a goose, mostly because the goose would get annihilated.

Name: Black Canary
Summary: Don't make her raise her voice. You definitely won't like it.

Name: Black Canary
Summary: Screams really loud. Occasional secret agent and member of a punk rock band. Definitely cooler than your girlfriend.

Name: Black Cat
Summary: Master thief. Will occasionally kill a bird and give it to you as a present.

Name: Black Flash
Summary: The death of all speedsters. Really bad idea to challenge him to a 100m dash.

Name: Black Goliath
Summary: A genius scientist with the ability to increase his physical size. Unfortunately he's most famous for getting killed by a rampaging Thor-bot.

Name: Black Knight
Summary: Wielder of a magic sword and subject of a sweet Deep Purple anthem.

Name: Black Lightning
Summary: Sometime teacher, sometime lightning-hurling vigilante. So much cooler than that teacher who used to let you drink coffee in class.

Name: Black Mamba
Summary: Enjoys hypnotising people and then suffocating them with darkness. Definitely swipe left.

Name: Black Manta
Summary: An evil scuba diver who really hates Aquaman and sometimes struggles to go through doors if he's facing forwards.

Name: Black Panther
Summary: The King of Wakanda and the host of an ancient panther god. Definitely better than you.

Name: Black Widow
Summary: The best spy in the business. Also part of the most prominent superhero team in the world, which shows just how good a spy she is.

Name: Blackout
Summary: He can make it really dark, and not just with his depressing emo poetry.

Name: Blackwulf
Summary: Inherited the ability to kill people with a touch from his dad. Also got a pocketwatch and an extensive collection of vintage pornography.

Name: Blade
Summary: Half human, half vampire. Fundamentally disagrees with trying to ice skate uphill.

Name: Blaquesmith
Summary: A future-dwelling tech genius with a perfect face for radio.

Name: Bling!
Summary: Shines bright like a diamond. Shines bright like a diamond.

Name: Blink
Summary: Survivor of a dark parallel universe ruled by a violent megalomaniac. Surprisingly well-adjusted, all things considered.

Name: Blizzard
Summary: The least famous ice-based criminal in the history of comic books.

Name: Blob
Summary: A giant mass of muscle and impenetrable skin. Enjoys wearing singlets. Advocate for body positivity.

Name: Bloodaxe
Summary: The most 90s comic book character of all time. Dresses like a wannabe Ghost Rider.

Name: Bloodhawk
Summary: Surprisingly benevolent devil man. A be-devil-ent man?

Name: Bloodwraith
Summary: Harnesses the power of the dead using a magic sword. Pretty much as metal as that makes him sound.

Name: Blue Beetle
Summary: Sort of like a bug-themed Iron Man who also knows Kung Fu.

Name: Blue Beetle II
Summary: A teenager who uses an ancient magical beetle to fight crime. I guess you gotta use what you got in this game?

Name: Boom-Boom
Summary: BOOM.

Name: Booster Gold
Summary: An egotistical time-traveller who spends most of his time failing upwards.

Name: Brainiac
Summary: An alien robot who wants to collect planets and keep them in bottles. Will probably try and tell you about his collection at dinner parties.

Name: Brainiac 5
Summary: A friendly alien robot from the future famous for kissing a whole lot of super-ladies.

Name: Brother Voodoo
Summary: A master of Voodoo magic and trained psychologist, but nobody ever asks him about the second thing.

Name: Bullseye
Summary: A master assassin, the only thing Bullseye truly misses is social cues telling him not to be such a bad guy.

Name: Bumblebee
Summary: Another in a long line of bug-themed superheroes. These people know there are cooler animals out there, right?

Name: Bushido
Summary: A master of martial arts with an arsenal of weapons possessed by people's souls. Really good at fighting goblins.

Name: Cable
Summary: A time-travelling mutant with a big gun and sometimes really tiny feet. Friends with young versions of his parents, fortunately never pulled a Marty McFly.

Name: Callisto
Summary: Has superhuman senses and yet still chooses to live in the sewer. Not the greatest decision maker.

Name: Cannonball
Summary: He's nigh-invulnerable when he's blastin'!

Name: Captain America
Summary: Super soldier and former human popsicle. Will definitely beat you at ultimate frisbee.

Name: Captain Atom
Summary: A quantum powered superhero in the geniune sense, not just the sense that 'quantum' is a cool word.

Name: Captain Britain
Summary: Like Captain America. Only British. And magically empowered by Merlin. And married to an elf. So not much like Captain America, really.

Name: Captain Cold
Summary: Master thief with a freeze ray and a penchant for wearing a parka even when it's nice out.

Name: Captain Mar-vell
Summary: An alien warrior whose name is very familiar for some reason...

Name: Captain Marvel
Summary: Boss of space, enrager of misogynist manbabies. Higher. Further. Faster.

Name: Captain Universe
Summary: When Captain America thinks too small, and Captain Planet can't stop bothering those teens, you can call on Captain Universe!

Name: Carnage
Summary: A psychopath wrapped up in a murderous alien slime-blanket. Dislikes include fire and loud noises. Likes include eating your literal face.

Name: Catwoman
Summary: Master thief. Occasionally coughs up a furball and decides to lie on your face while you're trying to sleep.

Name: Cecilia Reyes
Summary: A force field-generating doctor whose superpower is destined to put her out of work.

Name: Century
Summary: An alien consciousness who sometimes dresses like a priest. Less obviously evil than he looks.

Name: Cerebra
Summary: A future-dwelling mutant who can shut off people's nervous systems, and doesn't get why people don't like it when she does that to them.

Name: Chamber
Summary: A British misanthrope with a cool coat. Takes great offense if you describe something as 'jaw-dropping'.

Name: Chameleon
Summary: He could be anyone. He could be right behind you. He could even be YOU. Actually that's unlikely, but he could be probably anyone else.

Name: Changeling
Summary: The greatest foe of the X-Men! The awesome power of the...no actually, he died almost immediately. Never mind.

Name: Cheetah
Summary: An archaeologist cursed to become a woman-cheetah by an evil god. Definitely as bitter about it as you'd assume.

Name: Citizen Steel
Summary: Made of metal, but he'll be damned if he claims to have a title like 'Captain' or 'Commander' when he hasn't earned it!

Name: Clea
Summary: Daughter of a demon, student and lover of Doctor Strange. Didn't inherit her dad's big flaming head.

Name: Cloak
Summary: Inside his cloak is an endless dimension in which everything could be lost. May connect to the endless dimension down the back of the couch cushions.

Name: Clock King
Summary: He's the king of CLOCK, there is none higher, sucker MCs should call him SIRE, to burn his kingdom, you must use FIRE, he won't stop clocking till he RETIRES.

Name: Colossal Boy
Summary: He's a boy. He's colossal. He has a limited imagination when it comes to codenames. He's Colossal Boy!

Name: Colossus
Summary: Russian farmboy with a heart of steel. And a brain of steel. And...well, pretty much everything of steel really.

Name: Copycat
Summary: Won't just copy your homework. She'll copy your face, your body, your LIFE. Also your homework, but that seems like less of an issue.

Name: Corsair
Summary: Space pirate with a fantastic moustache and a love of getting it on with sexy alien ladies. Like a cross between Captain Kirk and Magnum PI.

Name: Cottonmouth
Summary: Has the power of constantly needing a glass of water.

Name: Crimson Crusader
Summary: A superhero fanboy whose powers only work when he's around his sister, who unfortunately thinks he smells.

Name: Crimson Dynamo
Summary: A Russian robotman with a hard-on for hating Iron Man.

Name: Crystal
Summary: A member of an alien royal family. Considered a horrible tax drain by many of her subjects.

Name: Cyborg
Summary: What happens when you cross a star college athlete with a computer from a futuristic hell-planet? Cyborg happens! What, you were expecting a joke?

Name: Cyborg Superman
Summary: The only way Superman could be improved is if he had a computer for a brain, right? Right?

Name: Cyclops
Summary: Definitely has heat vision, regardless of what he tells you. Also kind of the worst.

Name: Cypher
Summary: The gayest X-Man.

Name: Dagger
Summary: She'll stab you up.

Name: Daredevil
Summary: The Man Without Fear. Also a blind Catholic ninja lawyer. He's got a lot going on, honestly.

Name: Darkhawk
Summary: A bird-themed alien robot man who is nowhere near as evil as his costume makes him look.

Name: Darkseid
Summary: Darkseid is.

Name: Darkstar
Summary: A Russian government-sponsored superhero who can control darkness. Friends with a drunk bear.

Name: Dazzler
Summary: Converts sound into light, so kindly requests that you shut up around her. Also a global pop star, so double shut up.

Name: Deadman
Summary: A ghost who cannot interact with the physical world yet will still annoy the crap out of you if he gets a chance.

Name: Deadpool
Summary: The Merc with a Mouth. Superpowers include eating chimichangas and annoying the balls off people. Weaknesses include shutting up.

Name: Deadshot
Summary: Never misses his target. Unless his target is Batman. Or Green Arrow. Or really anyone relevant or important.

Name: Deathlok
Summary: Death row criminal forcibly combined with hyper-adaptive cyborg prosthetics. Did anybody honestly think that was a good idea?

Name: Deathstroke
Summary: Master assassin. Apparently the codename MurderJerk was taken.

Name: Demogoblin
Summary: Imagine if the Green Goblin was an actual goblin and yet somehow less creepy than a guy who thinks he's a goblin.

Name: Destroyer
Summary: A sentient suit of Asgardian armour that could kill you with its face.

Name: Diamondback
Summary: A criminal who has chosen a snake theme for seemingly no reason.

Name: Doc Samson
Summary: It's difficult to trust a psychotherapist who has a ponytail, much less one who has a GREEN ponytail and super Hulk-strength.

Name: Doctor Doom
Summary: Tyrannical dictator of an Eastern European country, master of science and magic and was once God for a bit. Very strong time management skills.

Name: Doctor Fate
Summary: Communes with ancient spirits of Order and Chaos, frequently suffers from nightmarish helmet-hair.

Name: Doctor Octopus
Summary: Definitely a doctor, the octopus part is debatable. Certainly has more arms than he knows what to do with.

Name: Doctor Strange
Summary: Wizard and protector of Earth against mystical threats. Has messed up hands but strong facial hair game.

Name: Domino
Summary: Luck be a lady toniiiiiiight!

Name: Donna Troy
Summary: Maybe the daughter of Wonder Woman. Maybe she was made out of clay. Your guess is as good as hers.

Name: Doomsday
Summary: Superman-killing rock monster that doesn't seem to be able to do what it was built to do without dying. 2/10, would not use again.

Name: Doppelganger
Summary: Has the unfortunate distinction of being the most pointless and unmemorable Spider-clone in the Marvel Universe. And that's a universe with Ben Reilly.

Name: Dormammu
Summary: An other-dimensional demon with a flaming head who really needs at least 100 of the Earth dollars!

Name: Dr Manhattan
Summary: He's big and blue, can see everything and anything all at once and he rejects your petty human notion of wearing pants.

Name: Drax the Destroyer
Summary: Former human jazz saxophonist turned super strong alien killing machine. Can stay so still he's basically invisible.

Name: Ego
Summary: A planet with a face. Looks a bit like Kurt Russell and apparently has a penis.

Name: Electro
Summary: Throws electricity from his hands and dresses a bit like a Christmas elf. Not the most intimidating supervillain, but his phone never runs out of battery.

Name: Elektra
Summary: "I'll slice you up like souvlaki" is definitely not one of Greek master assassin Elektra's catchphrases.

Name: Elongated Man
Summary: The long arm of justice...the very, VERY long arm...oh god, it's still stretching...I hate it but I can't look away...

Name: Emma Frost
Summary: Diamond-encrusted bikini-wearing British super-bitch who will definitely out-sass you.

Name: Enchantress
Summary: A meek, friendly graphic designer who happens to share her body with an ancient and insane sorceress. Good at drawing as well as killing.

Name: ERG-1
Summary: A ball of energy in a suit. And not just because he's had far too much sugar today.

Name: Etrigan
Summary: A rhymin' demon who'll keep you screamin'.

Name: Exodus
Summary: A powerful psychic villain whose powers increase when he's feeling more confident. So tell him his hair looks terrible and you'll beat him no problem.

Name: Fabian Cortez
Summary: Best known for his starring roles as Magneto's lackey, that guy who tried to betray Magneto and got his ass kicked, and...nope, that's about it.

Name: Falcon
Summary: A highly trained military combatant who flies around on mechanical wings and has a bird sidekick. Doesn't like it if you throw birdseed at him.

Name: Fallen One
Summary: Herald of Galactus. Favours cracked black pepper as a seasoning for the worlds his master devours.

Name: Faora
Summary: Basically Superman's evil aunt, but instead of bringing round slightly burnt cake she helps your dick uncle try and murder a planet.

Name: Feral
Summary: A vicious animalistic villain with hair that's seemingly bigger than her body.

Name: Fighting Spirit
Summary: A patriotic hero with a magic cloak and hat. Will beat you up if you say anything bad about America.

Name: Fin Fang Foom
Summary: Fin Fang Foom put you in his pants.

Name: Firebird
Summary: Fiery cosmic superhero. Also has a Master's degree in social work, but nobody ever asks her about that.

Name: Firelord
Summary: Fiery Herald of Galactus. Favours extra hot chilli powder as a seasoning for the worlds his master consumes.

Name: Firestar
Summary: Has the power to manipulate microwave energy. Can fry villains and cook a lasagne in 30 seconds flat.

Name: Firestorm
Summary: An old man and a young man share a body, but not in an illegal way. Also they are a human nuclear bomb, so that's comforting...

Name: Fixer
Summary: A criminal with a penchant for creating advanced technology. Definitely has a better phone than you.

Name: Flash
Summary: Flash! Aaaaah! Saviour of the Multiverse!

Name: Flash II
Summary: Wally West, the best Flash with the best hair. Got wiped out of reality because Doctor Manhattan was jealous of his hair.

Name: Forge
Summary: Great at fixing stuff, also a Native American shaman who once summoned a demon which threatened Earth, but we don't really talk about that.

Name: Franklin Richards
Summary: Imagine if your annoying kid brother could also shape realities with his mind. Probably mum's favourite...

Name: Franklin Storm
Summary: Father of the Invisible Woman and the Human Torch. No powers, except the superhuman ability to get himself arrested for stupid reasons.

Name: Frenzy
Summary: Super strong villain turned hero turned villain turned hero. Very flexible morals.

Name: Frigga
Summary: Thor's mum, and exactly as badass as you'd expect someone who breastfed the God of Thunder to be.

Name: Galactus
Summary: A cosmic force that always was and always will be. Eats planets like apples and moons like after-dinner mints.

Name: Gambit
Summary: The Ragin' Cajun with the ability to make things go boom. Mostly uses his power on his personal life.

Name: Gamora
Summary: I'll go you one better: Why is Gamora?!

Name: Garbage Man
Summary: He's a man. He's made of garbage. He's the Garbage Man. And worryingly, not the most useless character in this database.

Name: General Zod
Summary: Kneel before Zod! Bend before Zod! Do downward facing dog before Zod!

Name: Genesis
Summary: Like a cross between Harry Styles and an evil mutant supremacist. And also stretchy.

Name: Ghost Rider
Summary: A stunt motorcyclist who made a deal with the devil and got his head set on fire. Not a great deal.

Name: Ghost Rider II
Summary: A street racer who has the soul of a death row inmate in the boot of his car. Hitchhikers beware!

Name: Giant-Man
Summary: Once an Ant-Man, now a GiAnt-Man. Not the most original with names, but probably taller than you.

Name: Giganta
Summary: A big giant lady who enjoys fighting Wonder Woman and walks through the city. While stomping on everything, because she's giant.

Name: Gladiator
Summary: Alien warlord with a sweet mohawk who is powered by arrogance. Just like my ex-boyfriend, am I right?

Name: Goblin Queen
Summary: Insane demon psychic mutant clone who is definitely going to catch a cold if she goes out like that.

Name: Gog
Summary: An evil god who sounds like he was named by a child learning how to speak.

Name: Goliath
Summary: A big giant villain who sometimes pretends to be a hero. Hobbies involve stomping and struggling to find pants that fit properly.

Name: Gorilla Grodd
Summary: He's a psychic gorilla supervillain. I don't think there's anything more to be said there.

Name: Granny Goodness
Summary: Ironically-named caretaker of children on a flaming hell-planet. Has a handbag full of pain. And Werther's Originals.

Name: Gravity
Summary: Has gravity powers. Picked the codename Gravity. Weaknesses include imagination and creativity.

Name: Green Arrow
Summary: He's a grown man who dresses up and runs around trying to be Robin Hood. But he also has a boxing glove arrow, so he's kind of forgiven.

Name: Green Goblin
Summary: You don't have to be crazy to dress as a goblin and fly around throwing pumpkin bombs at innocent people, but he is!

Name: Groot
Summary: He is Groot.

Name: Guardian
Summary: Like a cross between Captain America and Iron Man, but Canadian so probably cheaper and a lot more polite.

Name: Guy Gardner
Summary: Imagine if your douchebag school bully got an object of immense cosmic power, and you've got Guy Gardner.

Name: Hal Jordan
Summary: If your cool older brother who was better at everything than you also became a heroic space-cop, he'd be Hal Jordan.

Name: Harley Quinn
Summary: Hammer-wielding sometime Juggalo and girlfriend of the worst guy in history. You definitely met her at university.

Name: Havok
Summary: Cyclops' energy-hurling younger brother. Probably never going to get that graduate degree he's been studying for.

Name: Hawk
Summary: An avatar of War who fights people while dressed as a big bird.

Name: Hawkeye
Summary: Clint Barton. SHIELD agent. Archer. The worst Avenger.

Name: Hawkeye II
Summary: Kate Bishop. Archer. Private Investigator. The best Hawkeye.

Name: Hawkgirl
Summary: An endlessly-reincarnating Egyptian princess with magic wings and an unbreakable attraction to Hawkman.

Name: Hawkman
Summary: An endlessly-reincarnating Egyptian prince with magic wings and an unbreakable attraction to Hawkgirl.

Name: Heat Wave
Summary: Top three songs: Burn Baby Burn, Disco Inferno, Dancin' in the Moonlight (unrelated to the fire thing, but just a good song).

Name: Hela
Summary: She's the goddess of death. Also the goddess of chewing scenery like a goddamn pro.

Name: Hellcat
Summary: The most intimidating woman named Patsy you'll ever meet. Except Patsy Kensit.

Name: Hellstorm
Summary: The Son of Satan. Not actually as evil as that makes him sound.

Name: Hercules
Summary: Son of Zeus, Olympian Avenger, demigod of strength and amazing feats. Could definitely drink you under the table.

Name: Hobgoblin
Summary: You know how Green Goblin is crazy? Now meet his weird cousin.

Name: Hollow
Summary: Diamond-hard skin, no ability to speak. Lives in a pocket dimension with her evil brother. Friendly if you give her a chance!

Name: Hope Summers
Summary: The Mutant Messiah. Also once got trapped inside the body of a small floating robot, so slightly different from the more famous Messiah...

Name: Howard the Duck
Summary: Shut the duck up.

Name: Hulk
Summary: You wouldn't like him when he's angry. Except millions of comic book readers do actually love him, especially when he's angry...

Name: Human Torch
Summary: Somehow manages to be a renowned and well-regarded superhero while still setting everything around him on fire.

Name: Huntress
Summary: She hunts the most dangerous game - CRIME!

Name: Husk
Summary: You'd probably be angry if you had to tear your own skin off every time you wanted to use your mutant power too.

Name: Hybrid
Summary: Former prison guard turned symbiotic superhero. Not as relatable as Venom or as deliciously evil as Carnage.

Name: Hydro-Man
Summary: A man made of water. Somehow still gets thirsty when he eats chips.

Name: Hyperion
Summary: Cosmically-powered other-dimensional superman whose greatest superpower is handsomeness.

Name: Iceman
Summary: Surprisingly warm-hearted for a man who could star in the one-man adaptation of Frozen.

Name: Impulse
Summary: Imagine if your irritating younger cousin gained the power of super speed. And was from the future, so knew what was going to happen to you...

Name: Indigo
Summary: AKA Brainiac 8, a friendly robot from the future and not as evil as some other members of her robot family who will remain unnamed...

Name: Ink
Summary: Well tattoo to you too.

Name: Invisible Woman
Summary: Dammit, I thought you picked one. Where is she...?

Name: Iron Fist
Summary: Punched a dragon, still managed to be the subject of the most boring Netflix show.

Name: Iron Man
Summary: Genius billionaire playboy philanthropist. Spends a lot of time building robots and sculpting his own facial hair.

Name: Iron Monger
Summary: Like Iron Man, if he was evil, and not smart, and a thief, and didn't have natty facial hair...

Name: Isis
Summary: She's named after the Egyptian Goddess, not...the other thing...it was just unfortunate.

Name: Jack of Hearts
Summary: Half-alien superhero who sometimes loses control and explodes. But not often.

Name: Jean Grey
Summary: Her superpower is dying quite a lot!

Name: Jennifer Kale
Summary: A witch who hangs out with Man-Thing and Throg and probably makes charcoal rubbings of gravestones.

Name: Jesse Quick
Summary: An alternate-universe speedster who accesses her abilities through the awesome power of MATHS!

Name: Jessica Cruz
Summary: A former agoraphobe thrust into a wider universe as a rookie member of the Green Lantern Corps. Socially awkward, totally relatable.

Name: Jessica Jones
Summary: Super strong private investigator whose real superpower is her endless appetite for bourbon.

Name: Jigsaw
Summary: Currently awaiting a court date to sue his plastic surgeon.

Name: John Constantine
Summary: Chain-smoking bisexual Liverpudlian sorcerer and con man. And only three of those things are turn-ons.

Name: John Stewart
Summary: Architect, soldier and now space magician. Not to be confused with the comedian and satirist, who definitely doesn't know space magic.

Name: John Wraith
Summary: A teleporting hitman who will shoot you from six different directions before you fall over.

Name: Joker
Summary: HahahahahahahHAHAHhahHAHAHAHhahA!

Name: Jolt
Summary: Naive young superhuman who found herself tangled up with villains. Turned out alright though, she's still a good kid.

Name: Jubilee
Summary: Pretty much the 90s in mutant form.

Name: Juggernaut
Summary: He's the Juggernaut, bitch!

Name: Junkpile
Summary: A mutant from the future who can rebuild his body with scrap metal. Sure, why not.

Name: Justice
Summary: A young mutant whose powers were activated by his future self, so he could grow into his future self and go back in time to activate his mutant powers, so he could...

Name: Kang
Summary: Time travelling megalomaniac. Not to be confused with Krang from Ninja Turtles.

Name: Kid Flash
Summary: Like the Flash, but a kid. And also wears the colours of Flash's greatest enemy. Let's not look too far into that...

Name: Kid Flash II
Summary: Kid Flash II: II Kid II Flash.

Name: Killer Croc
Summary: Ate his dermatologist.

Name: Killer Frost
Summary: She'll freeze your eyeballs if you tell her to chill out.

Name: Kilowog
Summary: The cigar chomping soon-to-retire no-nonsense police chief of the Green Lantern Corps. He'll have your gun and badge for that!

Name: King Shark
Summary: He's a SHAAAAAAAAAAAARK!

Name: Kingpin
Summary: If you interrupt him on a date, he'll decapitate you with a car door.

Name: Klaw
Summary: He's got a claw, right? What...? Made of sound? Ok then...at least he's not being obvious...

Name: Kraven the Hunter
Summary: He hunts the most dangerous game: Spider-Man!

Name: Krypto
Summary: The best boy.

Name: Kyle Rayner
Summary: When your overachieving rival at high school becomes a space cop and later some kind of magic space god.

Name: Lady Bullseye
Summary: More deadly than Lady Marmalade.

Name: Lady Deathstrike
Summary: Like Lady Gaga, but with more knives for hands.

Name: Leader
Summary: Living proof that if you try and Hulk yourself for evil, you'll end up a tiny douche with a massive head.

Name: Leech
Summary: Sucks your blood but in a medicinal way. No hang on, that's LEECHES. He's actually pretty cute.

Name: Legion
Summary: With thousands of divergent personalities, you'd think at least one of them would be a chill dude, right?

Name: Lex Luthor
Summary: Definitely isn't doing all of those evil things to compensate for his insecurities around being bald. Shut up.

Name: Lightning Lass
Summary: An alien with gravity manipulation powers, and apparently named by a stereotypical Scotsman.

Name: Lightning Lad
Summary: Brother of Lightning Lass, will electrocute you with very little encouragement.

Name: Lightning Lord
Summary: Evil older brother of Lightning Lass and Lightning Lad, bagsied the best codename for himself because he was the oldest.

Name: Living Brain
Summary: A friendly robot who once got possessed by Doctor Octopus and became less friendly and more like a calculator that tries to kill your aunt.

Name: Living Tribunal
Summary: Guardian of Multiversal Balance. Has no neck, but somehow pulls it off.

Name: Lizard
Summary: Proof that living with a physical disability is far superior to being a giant carnivorous lizard-man.

Name: Lobo
Summary: The Main Man, a hard-living bounty-hunting bastich from the depths of space. Probably dated your sister while she was going through that phase.

Name: Loki
Summary: Sometimes when you double-cross everyone, you just end up lying and doing random crap, the Loki Laufeyson story.

Name: Longshot
Summary: Has luck powers, but wasn't lucky enough to avoid his hairdresser giving him a mullet.

Name: Luke Cage
Summary: An unbreakable man who will go a long way and harass some pretty powerful people to get the 200 dollars he's owed.

Name: Luna
Summary: Part human, part Inhuman, fully adorable. She was born on the Moon, but people just think she's being an imaginative little liar.

Name: Lyja
Summary: A shapeshifting alien who definitely hooked up with half of the members of the Fantastic Four. Not telling you which half, though...

Name: Machine Man
Summary: A shit robot.

Name: Magneto
Summary: The Master of Magnetism. Will definitely bring up the fact that he was in a concentration camp to guilt you into paying for dinner.

Name: Magog
Summary: A violent and ruthless anti-hero who gets angry if you call him horny.

Name: Magus
Summary: An evil future version of Adam Warlock who is just as obsessed by the Infinity Gems as his heroic counterpart, but a touch more murdery.

Name: Man-Bat
Summary: The opposite of Batman.

Name: Man-Thing
Summary: The opposite of Thingman.

Name: Man-Wolf
Summary: The opposite of Wolfman.

Name: Mandarin
Summary: A racist caricature with magic alien space rings. Wouldn't have made it past the drawing board if he'd been created today.

Name: Mantis
Summary: She came here to kick names and take ass!

Name: Martian Manhunter
Summary: Good cop. Bad cop. Alien cop.

Name: Match
Summary: An evil clone of Superboy. Like an evil clone of Superman, but a boy.

Name: Maxima
Summary: An alien conqueror who has a raging wide-on for Superman.

Name: Medusa
Summary: Queen of the Inhumans, could definitely kill you with her hair but still hates making small talk in the hairdressers.

Name: Mephisto
Summary: Pretty much the actual devil, enjoys stealing people's marriages and making comic book fans super mad.

Name: Mera
Summary: Like a female Aquaman, except not lame.

Name: Metallo
Summary: Kryptonite-powered robot, gives zero cares about Asimov's Laws.

Name: Metamorpho
Summary: A shapeshifting superhero and former archaeologist who appears to have picked the exact same colour scheme as a Double Decker bar.

Name: Metron
Summary: An all-powerful being who spends most of his time sitting in a chair and judging people. Just like your angry grandad.

Name: Micro Lad
Summary: A teeny-tiny supervillain who really needs to get over the fact he was rejected from the Legion of Superheroes.

Name: Mimic
Summary: Definitely the sort of person who would repeat what you're saying just to be obnoxious.

Name: Misfit
Summary: Wannabe-Batgirl with the ability to teleport but very little in the way of costume design skills.

Name: Miss Martian
Summary: A member of the malevolent White Martian race who really doesn't want to be stereotyped in a box, guys.

Name: Mister Fantastic
Summary: Bend him, shape him, any way you want him.

Name: Mister Freeze
Summary: A far more nuanced and interesting character than Arnold Schwarzeneggar made him seem in THAT movie.

Name: Mister Knife
Summary: When being the King of an alien empire gets boring, it's time to become an organised crime boss. Of course...?

Name: Mister Mxyzptlk
Summary: Whatever you think the pronunciation is, you're definitely wrong.

Name: Mister Sinister
Summary: An evil geneticist who has the air of a guy trying to lure you into his underground BDSM club.

Name: Mister Zsasz
Summary: A masochistic serial killer and a surefire winner on the Scrabble board.

Name: Mockingbird
Summary: Ask her about her feminist agenda.

Name: MODOK
Summary: Probably makes this sound a lot: 'WAAAAH!'

Name: Mogo
Summary: A living planet recruited to be an intergalactic space cop. Comic books are weird.

Name: Moloch
Summary: A stage magic-themed supervillain who is most famous for dying of cancer.

Name: Molten Man
Summary: Not as delicious as a molten lava cake, but just as bad for your health.

Name: Monarch
Summary: Former hero turned totalitarian dictator of a future society, which is more of a normal career path than you might expect for a superhero.

Name: Moon Knight
Summary: Multiple personalities, not one of them cares about getting stains out of a pure white costume.

Name: Moonstone
Summary: Asshole psychiatrist turned superpowered villain. Sometimes pretends to be Captain Marvel, just to amp up the assholery.

Name: Morlun
Summary: An inter-dimensional energy vampire who loves eating spiders. Basically that weird goth roommate you had in college.

Name: Morph
Summary: A nice chap who is mostly good at doing people favours and dying horribly before he's able to do much of anything.

Name: Mr Immortal
Summary: There's only two things this guy can't do: die and make up a more imaginative codename.

Name: Ms Marvel II
Summary: The nicest and most helpful kid you could ever meet who also happens to have superpowers. You'll like her, everyone does.

Name: Multiple Man
Summary: Spawns an exact duplicate whenever he gets hit. Super annoying, so gets hit a lot...

Name: Mysterio
Summary: Special FX wizard who wears a fishbowl on his head and enters every room through a cloud of dry ice.

Name: Mystique
Summary: A shapeshifting mutant criminal who was everyone's mum at one point.

Name: Namor
Summary: The Douchebag of the Deep.

Name: Namora
Summary: Half-human, half-Atlantean, just as much of a jerk as her cousin Namor.

Name: Namorita
Summary: Daughter of Namora, didn't inherit her family's jerky tendencies. Famous for dying in a big explosion.

Name: Nebula
Summary: A bald blue space mercenary who has serious and unresolved daddy issues.

Name: Negasonic Teenage Warhead
Summary: Psychic goth kid with the best superhero name ever?

Name: Nick Fury
Summary: The greatest spy who only has one eye.

Name: Nightcrawler
Summary: The blue fuzzball who looks like a demon, sings like an angel and sometimes pretends to be a pirate.

Name: Nightwing
Summary: Former Robin turned fun-loving vigilante who only occasionally gets shot in the head and changes his entire personality.

Name: Nite Owl II
Summary: Essentially Blue Beetle but for legal reasons definitely entirely distinct from Blue Beetle. But essentially Blue Beetle.

Name: Northstar
Summary: The rudest Canadian you'll likely ever encounter.

Name: Nova
Summary: A space cop who can't be stopped.

Name: Nova
Summary: A child who was irresponsibly allowed to join the space cops. An insurance nightmare.

Name: Odin
Summary: The All-Father of Asgard. Makes your grumpy dad look like a kitten.

Name: Offspring
Summary: Son of Plastic Man, just as stretchy but far less annoying.

Name: Omega Red
Summary: Russian mutant energy vampire with metal tentacles, and just as hardcore as that makes him sound.

Name: One-Above-All
Summary: The Creator of All Life. Just as humble as his name makes him sound.

Name: Onslaught
Summary: The living embodiment of psychic evil and destruction. Dresses like a big giant Magneto for some reason.

Name: Oracle
Summary: Tech genius and former Batgirl who probably hacked a government satellite for fun before you'd even had breakfast this morning.

Name: Osiris
Summary: Former villain turned hero and brother of Isis. Has a much more fortunate codename than his sister these days.

Name: Ozymandias
Summary: Look upon his works, ye Mighty, and despair! Especially if you don't like big giant alien squid!

Name: Parademon
Summary: Bluuurgh. Glaaargh! Raaaargh!

Name: Penguin
Summary: Gotham City crime boss with the amazing ability to swallow entire fish whole.

Name: Phantom
Summary: As played by the rich asshole guy from Titanic.

Name: Phantom Girl
Summary: A girl with the amazing ability to not touch anything ever.

Name: Phoenix
Summary: A cosmic firebird of destruction and resurrection. Also sometimes a lady. And other times an evil lady who eats the sun.

Name: Plantman
Summary: A plant-themed supervillain. Occasionally gets pollinated by Bumblebee and isn't that happy about it.

Name: Plastic Man
Summary: Imagine having a Stretch Armstrong thrown at your head every minute of every day. Either you have young children, or you live with Plastic Man.

Name: Plastique
Summary: BOOM.

Name: Poison Ivy
Summary: She is nature's arm. Her spirit. Her will. Made of plants, but famously doesn't get along with Swamp Thing.

Name: Polaris
Summary: The daughter of Magneto, inherited her dad's mutant powers but the green hair is all her own.

Name: Power Girl
Summary: Superpowers include flight, super strength, and coping with men staring her right in the boob-window.

Name: Power Man
Summary: Converts history and knowledge from his surroundings into physical strength. Doesn't get much out of new builds.

Name: Professor X
Summary: A bald psychic mutant who is definitely judging you for what you're thinking about right now.

Name: Professor Zoom
Summary: Moves really fast, kills people. Not sure why he felt the need to give himself a fake title, but fraud is the least of his crimes.

Name: Psylocke
Summary: A British psychic ninja, and exactly as cool as that makes her sound.

Name: Punisher
Summary: Will shoot you in the face for littering. Needs to smile more.

Name: Purple Man
Summary: He's a man. He's purple. Also a mind-controlling sex predator, which makes the purple thing fairly minor, really.

Name: Pyro
Summary: Imagine if that friend you had growing up who liked to start fires got superpowers. Exactly as evil as you might think.

Name: Question
Summary: All the good men are either gay or have no face.

Name: Quicksilver
Summary: He's fast like lightning, but not very frightening. Mostly because he wears a skintight onesie.

Name: Ra's Al Ghul
Summary: An immortal master assassin with a borderline unpronouncable name.

Name: Raven
Summary: That's so Raven!

Name: Ray
Summary: Does actually have light ray-based powers. He's not just a guy named Ray...

Name: Razor-Fist II
Summary: Razor-Fist 2: Electric Boogaloo.

Name: Red Arrow
Summary: Like Green Arrow, but red. Weaknesses include bulls.

Name: Red Hood
Summary: Former Robin turned occasional murderer. Has serious unresolved Bat-daddy issues.

Name: Red Hulk
Summary: Like the Hulk but turns a colour that's actually far more synonymous with anger than his green counterpart. Maybe the Hulk is actually envious of something?

Name: Red Robin
Summary: Like Robin, but red. Weaknesses include bulls.

Name: Red Skull
Summary: A superscience-obssessed Nazi and walking advertisement for sun cream.

Name: Red Tornado
Summary: Like a Tornado, but red. Weaknesses include bulls.

Name: Rhino
Summary: A Russian with the strength of a rhino who dresses like a rhino and calls himself Rhino. It's best to keep things simple sometimes.

Name: Rick Flag
Summary: Soldier and field leader of the Suicide Squad. Significantly less likely to end up dead than most of his teammates.

Name: Riddler
Summary: What belongs to you, but is used by others? YOUR NAME! HAHAHA RIDDLES!

Name: Rip Hunter
Summary: Master of the Time Stream, semi-skilled creator of false names.

Name: Ripcord
Summary: A former prostitute turned pheremone-spraying superhero. Level of physical attractiveness is reliant on political opinions of the artist.

Name: Robin
Summary: The Boy Wonder!

Name: Robin II
Summary: The Boy Wonder 2: 2 Boys 2 Wonder.

Name: Robin III
Summary: The Boy Wonder 3: This Time It's Personal.

Name: Robin V
Summary: The Boy Wonder 4: The Quest for Peace.

Name: Rocket Raccoon
Summary: Takes great offense to the term 'trash panda'.

Name: Rogue
Summary: A Southern belle who'll kick you straight to hell.

Name: Ronin
Summary: When Hawkeye gets sad and briefly dies, he comes back as a masterless samurai. Sure.

Name: Rorschach
Summary: He's not trapped on this website with you. You're trapped on this website with him!

Name: Sabretooth
Summary: A vicious killer who is a reflection of the Marvel Comics editorial team in his weird obsession with Wolverine.

Name: Sage
Summary: A human computer who is definitely better at hard sums than even your really smart maths teacher.

Name: Sandman
Summary: A man, made of sand. Even gets caught in his own underpants.

Name: Sasquatch
Summary: A genius physicist who is most often seen slightly blurry and just off-camera.

Name: Scarecrow
Summary: Really good at terrifying birds. Also people.

Name: Scarlet Spider
Summary: A clone of Spider-Man who brings almost nothing extra to the role.

Name: Scarlet Witch
Summary: A master of chaos magic and probability. Great to have on your team on a trip to Vegas.

Name: Scorpia
Summary: Scorpion-themed villain. Not as into astrology as you might think.

Name: Scorpion
Summary: A grown man who dresses as a scorpion and somehow thinks that's fine.

Name: Sebastian Shaw
Summary: A mutant who dresses like a Victorian aristocrat and gets bigger every time you punch him in his stupid face.

Name: Sentry
Summary: A nice family man who has the power of the sun and also a dark side that might tear you in half just for the hell of it. Weird at neighbourhood barbecues.

Name: Shadow King
Summary: A psychic shadow-spider who wears a fez. Fezzes are cool.

Name: Shadow Lass
Summary: A supervillainous master of darkness apparently named by a stereotypical Scotsman.

Name: Shadowcat
Summary: Has no relation to either shadows or cats, but in her defense she came up with the codename as a teenager and it stuck.

Name: Shang-Chi
Summary: Basically an Asian James Bond who also knows kung fu. So way better than James Bond.

Name: Shatterstar
Summary: The physical embodiment of the life lesson that even having two swords and being an elite alien warrior can't make a ponytail look cool.

Name: Shazam
Summary: A boy in the body of a superman. A bit like the movie Big, except without the part where a grown woman has sex with a child.

Name: She-Hulk
Summary: An expert lawyer who goes green and massive every time someone says 'objection'.

Name: Shocker
Summary: Really good at holding one finger down while stretching the others out.

Name: Shriek
Summary: A screamy angry supervillain who will literally talk your ear off. As in, your ear will look like dog food by the time she's finished with it.

Name: Sif
Summary: An Asgardian hero who is way more competent than Thor but never gets any credit. Hater of glass ceilings.

Name: Silk
Summary: A spider-hero who spent most of her life locked in a bunker, and yet is surprisingly well-adjusted.

Name: Silk Spectre
Summary: A burlesque dancer turned superhero turned lonely alcoholic. Not the most spectacular career path, she'll be the first to admit.

Name: Silk Spectre II
Summary: Daughter of the original Silk Spectre, significantly less depressive than her predecessor.

Name: Silver Surfer
Summary: A cosmically-empowered surfer dude who looks like a hood ornament.

Name: Silverclaw
Summary: A silver-skinned shapeshifter who can take the form of any South American fauna. Very few characters have more specific superpowers than her.

Name: Simon Baz
Summary: A rookie member of the Green Lantern Corps who carries a gun, seemingly forgetting that he can make as many guns as he wants with his magic space ring.

Name: Sinestro
Summary: Yellow Space Hitler who has a Magic Yellow Space Ring and uses it to do Magic Yellow Space Hitler things.

Name: Siren
Summary: Aquatic supervillain who also thinks Aquaman's powers are dumb.

Name: Siryn
Summary: Screaming Irish superhero. Loads of fun once she's got a few pints of Guinness in her.

Name: Skaar
Summary: Son of the Hulk and an alien princess. Exactly as sulky and entitled as that makes him sound.

Name: Snowbird
Summary: Shapeshift who can take the form of any North Canadian animal. Very few characters have more specific superpowers than her.

Name: Sobek
Summary: A for-reals crocodile. Not much more needs to be said here, I don't think.

Name: Solomon Grundy
Summary: Born on a Monday and hesitant to let anybody forget that fact.

Name: Songbird
Summary: Uses sound as a weapon. Used to be evil and called herself Screaming Mimi, but she got better.

Name: Speedball
Summary: Surprisingly anti-drugs considering the odd choice of codename.

Name: Speedy
Summary: A master archer and Green Arrow protege. Not actually as fast as her name suggests.

Name: Spider-Girl
Summary: Spider-Girl. Spider-Girl. Does whatever a spider...curl...?

Name: Spider-Gwen
Summary: Spider-Gwen. Spider-Gwen. Does whatever a spider...cen...?

Name: Spider-Man
Summary: Is he strong? Listen bud. He's got radioactive blood.

Name: Spider-Woman
Summary: Spider-Woman. Spider-Woman. Does whatever a spider...wo-can?

Name: Spyke
Summary: Grows pointed bone spurs out of his body at will. Really bad at hugs.

Name: Star-Lord
Summary: Gamora's long-term booty call. Also an idiot.

Name: Stardust
Summary: Cosmically powered Herald of Galactus. Favours sea salt as a seasoning on the worlds to be consumed by her master.

Name: Starfire
Summary: An alien princess whose real name is Koriand'r. Sometimes hangs out with Salt 'n' Pepa.

Name: Stargirl
Summary: A girl with a cosmically powered staff and a sweet robot sidekick. She's living her best life.

Name: Static
Summary: Electromagnetic hero who breaks his electronic devices so frequently he doesn't even know what Twitter is.

Name: Steel
Summary: A wannabe-Superman with a suit of robot armour and a giant hammer. Actually one of the better Superman copycats out there.

Name: Steppenwolf
Summary: A powerful cosmic villain who still manages to be a boring blob of CGI when it really matters.

Name: Storm
Summary: A mutant weather goddess who is one of the few people in the world who can pull off a mohawk.

Name: Sunspot
Summary: A billionaire who converts solar energy to super strength. Wouldn't cope well in Sheffield.

Name: Superboy
Summary: Like Superman, but a boy. Wears a leather jacket and probably think you're lame.

Name: Superboy-Prime
Summary: Like Superman, but a boy-prime. Sometimes tries to destroy the multiverse because he's all angry.

Name: Supergirl
Summary: Like Superman, but a girl. Definitely makes your girlfriend look bad in comparison.

Name: Superman
Summary: Like Superboy, but a man. Definitely makes your boyfriend look bad in comparison.

Name: Swamp Thing
Summary: He's a thing that dwells in the swamp. Also protector of all plants across the world, but sure, let's linger on the swamp part.

Name: Swarm
Summary: HE'S MADE OF BEES!

Name: Synch
Summary: Has the ability to perfectly synchronise himself with another person. Will definitely steal your sweet moves on the dancefloor and pass them off as his own.

Name: Taskmaster
Summary: A mercenary with photographic reflexes. Will definitely copy your sweet moves on the dancefloor and pass them off as his own.

Name: Thanos
Summary: The Mad Titan and bringer of the Snappening. Has interesting views on overpopulation.

Name: The Comedian
Summary: He kills every single night. But not on stage. With a gun. He's not really that funny, to be totally honest with you.

Name: Thing
Summary: It's clobberin' time!

Name: Thor
Summary: The God of Hammers. No, wait, the God of Thunder. I'm always confusing those two things...

Name: Thor II
Summary: Not 'Lady Thor'. Not 'Girl Thor'. Just 'Thor'. OK?

Name: Thunderstrike
Summary: A man with a magic mace and a fairly terrible haircut.

Name: Thundra
Summary: Other-dimensional super-strong uber-feminist who will not take any shit from the patriarchy.

Name: Tiger Shark
Summary: Desperately wants to get rid of his mohawk but it's actually a fin so he's screwed...

Name: Tigra
Summary: A cat lady, but not the sad kind that smells like biscuits.

Name: Tinkerer
Summary: A technical genius and somehow seemingly the oldest person in this database full of gods and immortals.

Name: Toad
Summary: Hops like a toad, licks like a toad, loses the genetic lottery like a sucker.

Name: Toxin
Summary: The child of Carnage bonded with an honest New York City cop. Exactly as conflicted as you might imagine.

Name: Trickster
Summary: Favourite day: April 1st. Best prank: mass murder, hilarious right? Fashion sense: wack.

Name: Trigon
Summary: Demon daddy. And not in the fun way.

Name: Triplicate Girl
Summary: A pretty nice lady. A pretty nice lady. A pretty nice lady.

Name: Triton
Summary: A fish boy who lives on the Moon and somehow has managed to not suffocate. Gotta give him respect for that.

Name: Two-Face
Summary: Doesn't technically have two faces so much as two halves of two different faces equalling roughly one single face, but One-Face isn't as intimidating.

Name: Ultragirl
Summary: A half-human, half-Kree hero. Or possibly a mutant. Or a Kree mutant. Come back to us on this one.

Name: Ultron
Summary: The genocidal robot offspring of an insect-obsessed scientist and exactly as personable as you might expect.

Name: Valkyrie
Summary: An Asgardian warrior who shares a body with a mild-mannered human archaeologist. Valkyrie is slightly better at fighting.

Name: Vanisher
Summary: Vanisher is...hang on, he was supposed to be here. Where did he go? Oh, Vanisher...

Name: Venom
Summary: Disgruntled reporter + alien slime-blanket = surprisingly successful movie.

Name: Vertigo
Summary: Denizen of the Savage Land with the power of psionic equilibrium distortion. Also known as making people real dizzy.

Name: Vibe
Summary: Has the superhuman ability to divine exactly how fun a nightclub is going to be...oh wait, not that kind of Vibe...

Name: Vision
Summary: A synthezoid robot whose family tree includes two metahuman grandparents, a psychotic robot dad and a mutant wife. At least he's happy.

Name: Vixen
Summary: Uses a magic amulet to become as strong as an elephant. Doesn't particularly enjoy trips to the circus.

Name: Vulcan
Summary: The third Summers brother, despotic ruler of an intergalactic empire and yet Cyclops is STILL the worst.

Name: Vulture
Summary: An old man dressed as a bird who only became interesting after he was played by Michael Keaton in a film.

Name: War Machine
Summary: A bit like Iron Man but with more guns and less arrogance.

Name: Warbird
Summary: AKA Carol Danvers AKA binary AKA Ms Marvel AKA Captain Marvel. Badass, but very indecisive when it comes to codenames.

Name: Warlock
Summary: A friendly alien robot who loves his human-mutant friends and definitely can't translate to live action because he's essentiall a walking scribble.

Name: Warp
Summary: A teleporting French supervillain who primarily uses his powers to export stinky unpasteurised cheese without needing to declare it to customs.

Name: Warpath
Summary: A big, strong, quiet Native American. No hang on, that's the description for The Chief from One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest...

Name: Wasp
Summary: She's got a STING IN HER TAIL. Get it, because she's a...wasp...? Whatever, she's still cooler than Ant-Man.

Name: Watcher
Summary: A cosmic being with a big bald baby head who can only watch events but not interfere. Except for all those times he interfered...

Name: White Canary
Summary: Arch-nemesis of the Black Canary, very prone to stains.

Name: Winter Soldier
Summary: A brainwashed Soviet assassin with a metal arm and no memory of the horrific things he's done. Is somewhat redeemed by having nice hair.

Name: Wolfsbane
Summary: A Scottish girl who suffers from powerful Catholic guilt. Also she's a werewolf, so she suffers from that as well.

Name: Wolverine
Summary: The best there is at what he does. But what he does is be a short Canadian with claws. No, that doesn't sound right...

Name: Wonder Girl
Summary: Her mum is human, her dad is famous Greek horndog deity Zeus. Like Wonder Woman, but a girl.

Name: Wonder Man
Summary: A pacifist movie star who is made of energy and refuses to remove his sunglasses like Bono.

Name: Wonder Woman
Summary: Amazonian, but pays her employees a fair wage unlike Bezos.

Name: X-23
Summary: Clone of Wolverine, although they clearly took out the short and ugly genes. The best Wolverine, don't message me.

Name: X-Man
Summary: Prophesied saviour of mutantkind. Not super original with the codenames.

Name: Yellowjacket
Summary: Grows massive or shrinks really small. Also wears a yellow jacket. Named after said jacket, maybe?

Name: Zatanna
Summary: .tah pot looc a sraeW .sdrawkcab skaepS .resu cigam retsaM

Name: Zoom
Summary: Super fast asshole. Super fast-hole? Also hails from the future and is a serial killer.
